Overview.summary: This week in financial markets has been marked by significant movements across various sectors, driven by a mix of corporate earnings reports, economic data releases, and geopolitical developments. The major U.S. stock indexes experienced fluctuations, with notable performances in technology and consumer discretionary sectors. Additionally, the Federal Reserve's upcoming policy decisions and speeches have kept investors on edge. This report provides a comprehensive analysis of the key financial events and trends observed this week.

Major Indexes.summary: The U.S. stock market saw a mix of gains and losses throughout the week. On Wednesday, August 21, 2024, the S&P 500 rose by 0.4%, closing at 5,620.85 points. The Dow Jones Industrial Average (DJIA) added 0.1%, reaching 40,890.49 points, while the Nasdaq Composite increased by 0.6% to 17,918.99 points ([AP News](https://apnews.com/article/dow-jones-stock-market-fed-powell-78f6be126e37d88fcd8d8bf6efeb55b8)).
details: However, the market experienced a downturn on Thursday, August 22, 2024, with the S&P 500 falling by 0.9% to 5,570.64 points, the DJIA dropping 0.4% to 40,712.78 points, and the Nasdaq Composite declining by 1.7% to 17,619.35 points ([AP News](https://apnews.com/article/stock-markets-fed-inflation-earnings-japan-a829ed05df2841063ed5da6fb3767a98)).

Sector Performance.summary: Technology and consumer discretionary stocks led the gains earlier in the week. The S&P 500 and Nasdaq Composite both notched their longest winning streaks of 2024, with the S&P 500 rising nearly 1% and the Nasdaq Composite increasing by 1.4% on Monday ([Yahoo Finance](https://finance.yahoo.com/news/stock-market-today-sp-500-nasdaq-notch-longest-win-streaks-of-2024-as-august-turnaround-continues-200102693.html)). Notable performers included Nvidia (NVDA), which rose more than 4%, and AMD (AMD), which also saw a 4% increase following its announcement to acquire ZT Systems for $4.9 billion ([Yahoo Finance](https://finance.yahoo.com/news/stock-market-today-sp-500-nasdaq-notch-longest-win-streaks-of-2024-as-august-turnaround-continues-200102693.html)).
details: Energy stocks also showed strength, with the Energy Select Sector SPDR Fund (XLE) up by 0.8%, followed by gains in consumer discretionary and real estate sectors ([Yahoo Finance](https://finance.yahoo.com/news/stock-market-today-sp-500-nasdaq-notch-longest-win-streaks-of-2024-as-august-turnaround-continues-200102693.html)).

Corporate Earnings.summary: Several major companies reported their quarterly earnings this week, influencing market movements. Target (TGT) jumped after exceeding profit expectations for the spring, while Macy's (M) dropped after cutting its sales forecast for the year due to more discriminating shoppers ([AP News](https://apnews.com/article/dow-jones-stock-market-fed-powell-78f6be126e37d88fcd8d8bf6efeb55b8)).
details: Advance Auto Parts (AAP) tumbled by 17.5% after its profit for the latest quarter fell short of Wall Street's expectations, citing a "challenging demand environment" and lowering its full-year profit forecast ([AP News](https://apnews.com/article/stock-markets-fed-inflation-earnings-japan-a829ed05df2841063ed5da6fb3767a98)).

Inflation and Employment.summary: The market's attention was also focused on economic data releases. A report showed a slight increase in U.S. workers applying for unemployment benefits, adding to the mixed signals about the economy's health ([AP News](https://apnews.com/article/stock-markets-fed-inflation-earnings-japan-a829ed05df2841063ed5da6fb3767a98)).

Federal Reserve.summary: Investors are eagerly awaiting Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell's speech at the Jackson Hole Economic Symposium on Friday. The speech is expected to provide insights into the Fed's future monetary policy, particularly regarding interest rate cuts. As of Monday, traders were pricing in a 72% chance of a 0.25% rate cut and a 28% chance of a 0.50% cut at the next meeting ([Yahoo Finance](https://finance.yahoo.com/news/stock-market-today-sp-500-nasdaq-notch-longest-win-streaks-of-2024-as-august-turnaround-continues-200102693.html)).

Asia and Europe.summary: Global stock markets showed mixed performances. South Korea's Kospi rose by 0.2% after the Bank of Korea decided to keep rates unchanged, while Hong Kong's Hang Seng jumped by 1.4% ([AP News](https://apnews.com/article/stock-markets-fed-inflation-earnings-japan-a829ed05df2841063ed5da6fb3767a98)). In Europe, indexes made mostly modest moves, reflecting cautious sentiment ahead of the Fed's policy announcements.

Oil Market.summary: Oil prices faced a weekly decline due to demand concerns and ongoing geopolitical tensions in Gaza. The market's focus remains on the potential impact of these factors on global oil supply and demand dynamics ([Bloomberg](https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2024-08-22/latest-oil-market-news-and-analysis-for-aug-23)).

Conclusion.summary: This week has been eventful for financial markets, with significant movements driven by corporate earnings, economic data, and anticipation of Federal Reserve policy decisions. The technology and consumer discretionary sectors have shown resilience, while energy stocks have also performed well. However, mixed economic signals and geopolitical uncertainties continue to weigh on investor sentiment. As the week concludes, all eyes are on the Jackson Hole Economic Symposium, where Fed Chair Jerome Powell's speech is expected to provide crucial insights into the future direction of U.S. monetary policy.
